Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
CAN: The student may attempt to draw a basic animal or plant but with minimal detail (e.g., a simple fish shape without recognition of its environment).
The student might show a vague environment outline but not connected to the animal or plant (e.g., grass randomly placed around a drawing).
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly illustrate specific habitats (e.g., fish not in water or deer not in forest) *(student doesn’t recognize habitat association)*.
The student may not use labels to indicate necessary resources (e.g., water, air, soil) *(student doesn’t know these connections)*.
The student is likely unable to show how animals or plants use materials to survive (e.g., no indication that fish need water) *(student lacks this understanding)*.
The student might incorrectly label or show connections between animals and their habitats (e.g., may label habitat as a different animal entirely) *(misunderstanding of labels)*.
The drawing may not demonstrate understanding of functioning systems between living things and resources *(system concept not clear to student)*.
